intro: Atropis tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved atropis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, thread-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
